gw.api.rest

Class RestHttpHeaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.rest.RestHttpHeaders

  • public class RestHttpHeaders
extends java.lang.Object
    These are headers that REST deals with.

    This defines the standard no cache values for (@link HttpHeaders.CACHE_CONTROL) and (@link HttpHeaders.EXPIRES)

    In addition to headers defined here, other standard headers are used: (@link HttpHeaders.ACCEPT_LANGUAGE) (@link HttpHeaders.ACCEPT) (@link HttpHeaders.CONTENT) (@link gw.logging.TraceabilityIDConstants.TRACEABILITY_ID_HEADER)

    As far as the response headers are concerned you might want to read https://restpatterns.mindtouch.us/Articles/Caching_Matters

      static java.lang.String CACHE_CONTROL_MAX_AGE_PREFIX
      This setsup the prefix for declaring the max age of document.
      static java.lang.String DB_TRANSACTION_ID
      This is a context property (originating in a request header with the same name) representing a database transaction id, if supplied only one database commit with this id will be permitted.
      static java.lang.String GW_LANGUAGE_HEADER
      This is Guidewire's language setting, it may differ from the locale.
      static java.lang.String GW_LOCALE_HEADER
      This is Guidewire's locale setting, it may differ from the language.
      static java.lang.String INCLUDE_SCHEMA_PROPERTY
      This header permits the client to request that the schema used to create the object is returned
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> STD_CACHE_CONTROL
      This is the standard CACHE_CONTROL header values.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> STD_EXPIRES
      This is the standard EXPIRES header values
      static java.lang.String UNKNOWN_PROPERTY_HANDLING_HEADER
      This header permits the client to override the handling of unknown properties.
      static java.lang.String UNKNOWN_QUERY_PARAM_HANDLING_HEADER
      This header permits the client to override the handling of unknown query parameters.
      static java.lang.String VALIDATE_RESPONSE_HANDLING_HEADER
      This header permits the client to override the behavior around validating response

        public static final java.lang.String UNKNOWN_QUERY_PARAM_HANDLING_HEADER

      • DB_TRANSACTION_ID

        public static final java.lang.String DB_TRANSACTION_ID
        This is a context property (originating in a request header with the same name) representing a database transaction id, if supplied only one database commit with this id will be permitted. It is used for those transaction that are not idempotent. This maybe required by an operation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CACHE_CONTROL_MAX_AGE_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String CACHE_CONTROL_MAX_AGE_PREFIX
        This setsup the prefix for declaring the max age of document. I.e., this will tell the client to cache it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STD_CACHE_CONTROL

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.Object> STD_CACHE_CONTROL
        This is the standard CACHE_CONTROL header values. If you actually want to cache the results call addCacheHeadersToResponse

      • STD_EXPIRES

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.Object> STD_EXPIRES
        This is the standard EXPIRES header values
